mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: Rector and Visitors of the University of Virginia
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Arlington Street Church was the first public building to be constructed on the newly filled [Back Bay]. ... its exterior was inspired by St. Martin-in-the-Fields, London. ... The sanctuary ... was modeled after the Basilica della Santissima Annunziata del Vastato in Genoa, Italy. ... In 1898 the congregation voted to install memorial stained glass windows created by the studios of Louis C. Tiffany. The last of the 16 windows was installed in 1930. -- http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Arlington_Street_Church [work]
